intro: Truellum sieboldii, commonly known as the Japanese truellum, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Truellum sieboldii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
